channel.title: Ghast ball?
channel.description:
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZfUB447ei-s&feature=channel_video_title]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZfUB447ei-s&feature=channel_video_title[/url]
I was just playing with my friend when we heard an explosion and this was there?
Anybody know how to get rid of it or where its from?

item.title: Ghast ball?
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

reyx7:

[quote=minecraft wiki]When a player in an SMP server dies near Ghasts or is teleported out of the Nether to the surface world (not via a portal) there is a chance the Ghasts will follow them to their new location in the surface world. These Ghasts may act like normal Ghasts but could also behave radically differently than normal. Changes in teleported Ghasts include the Ghast-less explosions and Ghasts without explosions mentioned above. The teleported Ghast may also freeze in one location or “stalk” a certain player (moving closer to a player until they touch like a normal hostile mob) but both of these are extremely rare. [/quote]

We didn’t have a portal nor had we visited the nether, there was also no ghast just an explosion.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghast ball?
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:9, topic:404711”][quote=minecraft wiki]When a player in an SMP server dies near Ghasts or is teleported out of the Nether to the surface world (not via a portal) there is a chance the Ghasts will follow them to their new location in the surface world. These Ghasts may act like normal Ghasts but could also behave radically differently than normal. Changes in teleported Ghasts include the Ghast-less explosions and Ghasts without explosions mentioned above. The teleported Ghast may also freeze in one location or “stalk” a certain player (moving closer to a player until they touch like a normal hostile mob) but both of these are extremely rare. [/quote][/quote]oh, the fuck?

Read full topic

item.title: Ghast ball?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

When a player in an SMP server dies near Ghasts or is teleported out of the Nether to the surface world (not via a portal) there is a chance the Ghasts will follow them to their new location in the surface world. These Ghasts may act like normal Ghasts but could also behave radically differently than normal. Changes in teleported Ghasts include the Ghast-less explosions and Ghasts without explosions mentioned above. The teleported Ghast may also freeze in one location or "stalk" a certain player (moving closer to a player until they touch like a normal hostile mob) but both of these are extremely rare.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghast ball?

item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:7, topic:404711”][quote author=whattehp406 link=topic=501724.msg3670936#msg3670936 date=1310924858]

Ghasts can escape into the real world. But then again that doesn’t explain why there is a fireball with no Ghast…
[/quote]No they can’t.

Yes, they can.[/quote]

Id like to see that

Ghasts can escape into the real world. But then again that doesn’t explain why there is a fireball with no Ghast…
